ca.concordia.advanceprog.ui

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.concordia.advanceprog.ui.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The map is the holder of data that shows which cell of that two dimensional array is block, path or tower
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      boolean UserDefinedMapValidation(int entry, int exit, int height, int width)
      This method is responsible for checking if the user created map is valid or not by checking the start point, end point and the path from start to end

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D graphic)
        Render the map to the graphics context provided. The rendering is just simple fill rectangles
        Parameters:
        graphic - The graphics context on which to draw the map

      • drawCircle

        public void drawCircle(java.awt.Graphics2D graphic,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       int radius)
        This method is used in when we want to show a circle around a tower for the range of shooting
        Parameters:
        graphic - is the handle for depicting objects on it

      • isBlocked

        public boolean isBlocked(float x,
                         float y)
        Check if a particular location on the map is blocked. Note that the x and y parameters are floating point numbers meaning that we can be checking partially across a grid cell.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position to check for blocking
        y - The y position to check for blocking
        Returns:
        True if the location is blocked

      • isNotMap

        public boolean isNotMap(float x,
                        float y)
        This method will tell the caller if it is in the area of map
        Parameters:
        x - is the position in the x-Axis
        y - is the position in the y-Axis

      • tryMapXYtoCellNumber

        public static java.lang.String tryMapXYtoCellNumber(int x,
                                                    int y)
        This is very useful method that map the point (x,y) to the corresponding cell in the array of [15][15] or any user preference when wanted to create the map
        Parameters:
        x - the value x in the x-Axis
        y - the value of y-Axis

      • UserDefinedMapValidation

        public boolean UserDefinedMapValidation(int entry,
                                        int exit,
                                        int height,
                                        int width)
        This method is responsible for checking if the user created map is valid or not by checking the start point, end point and the path from start to end
